item.title: Customer segmentation via K-Means & Hierarchical clustering
item.description: body { text-align: justify} Consider to have a big mall in a specific city that contains information of its clients that subcribed to a membership card. The last feature is Spending Score that is a score that the mall computed for each of their clients based on several criteria including for example their income and the number of times per week they show up in the mall and of course, the amount of dollars they spent in a year.

item.title: Assessing the sucess of a new product via multiple classifiers
item.description: body { text-align: justify} These are a series of analysis to illustate the main classification algorithms and their advantages. The table shows the business clients of a company that has just launched a new product online. Some of the clients responded positively to the ads by buying the product and other responded negatively by not buying the product. The last column of the table tells for each user if the user bought the product or not.
